content.webTitle: Young voters: tell us your views about the general election

fields.headline: Young voters: tell us your views about the general election
fields.bodyText: After years of political turmoil in which Brexit has dominated the agenda, some voters will get the first chance to have their say on the future of the country on December 12. In the last general election, Labour experienced a significant increase in the number of young supporters – with 60% of voters aged 18-24 voting for Jeremy Corbyn’s party. While some MPs worry that this poll will fall at an awkward time for students, when many have travelled home for Christmas, almost a third of the 316,264 voter registration applications submitted within two days of its announcement were under 25. We want to hear from first-time and young voters ahead of the general election. How to contribute We are interested in hearing from people aged 18-24 about their feelings towards this election. Have you registered to vote? Have you decided who to vote for? Will you be voting tactically? Are you campaigning, and if so, how? Or maybe you’ve decided not to vote at all. To get in touch, please fill out the encrypted form below. You can also get in touch via WhatsApp by clicking here or adding the contact +44(0)7867825056. One of our journalists may be in touch with you and your response could be used in a feature. If you’re having trouble using the form, click here. Read terms of service here.
